text: Thanks <@U22PKFRU5> and non-Lukes!  Yes I have bookmarked everything I can find and am working my way through it all.  I wanted to do the dev certification but will keep an eye out for the remaining content now I know it's coming!  The GDD ones can keep my brain busy in the meantime!

Hi <!everyone>,

This is a video that shows some transition on scroll, please anyone let me know how to create heart image transition in section 2, asap. You can see here.

 <https://drive.google.com/file/d/16Om8HSGLhj1-EPqGoJFuRCwFnQfYsd7_/view>
Thanks for advance.
Please be careful with using @-everyone :sleeping:
Using it bypasses most (if not all) notification preferences.
Community Update - (at)Here mentions were already restricted, will restrict on (at)Everyone - appreciate the patience.

From the API it looks like you can pull all users: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/owners/get_owners>

There is also a "remoteList" object but it looks like it just pulls that same portal info. If you could add the additional portals under this, it would be awesome

Just make sure that it’s limited to agency contacts if you do. There are a lot of contractors and consultants out there that WOULD NOT want an agency being able to see all the portals they have access too.
Yes, that 10000000% it would def have to be an agency thing. I think doing a dashboard like Trish mentioned would be the best
I would assume it would be employees with @agencydomain.com only
Yep, that would be ideal. Overall I just want to make sure we’re not only updating the CMS from the Partner Agency perspective. The ecosystem is growing beyond that now.
Can we say I "actively lurk" :grimacing: :joy:
Thanks <@U22PKFRU5>
Hey Shawn, did you have that code within a <script> </script> element? that is jQuery code you have there.
<@U26BLKGE4> No I did not wrap it in a script tag, it works now in a script tag, I wasn't sure if the script tag was necessary.  Thank You.
<@UDC7FHVB8> - I would hunt around on <http://codepen.io> for ideas/code on how to develop that effect. What you find on there will likely work well on HubSpot CMS

Is there any way to remove the `<meta name="generator" content="HubSpot">` tag from HubSpot? It’s causing all HubSpot pages to be dinged in our Alexa report for having insecure meta tags. seems like it’s come up for some others as well <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/insecure-meta-tag-HubSpot/idi-p/32237>

As far as I can see, no you can’t remove it, and no it doesn’t really make a difference even if you did

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/insecure-meta-tag-HubSpot/idc-p/217756/highlight/true#M25375>
Does HubSpot maintain their Zapier integration? or does Zapier? Basically who do I make suggestions to?
<https://gph.is/1G3WGvv>
The HS/Zapier integration is built and maintained by Zapier.
How can I get the non-webp versions of image when showing a page?
normally open the image in browser and remove the variable stuff
whenever i try to save the image, it gives me the webp version when saving
i think its just a chrome issue
it only does that for me if the query params are in the url
this is when viewing a email as a webpage

it gives me a url like:
```
<https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hubfs/8675309/hub_generated/resized/06073e49-bd0f-42d2-bc71-ba124292917f.png>
```
forbidden hahahaha
poor jenny :disappointed:
:confused:
Any image that benefits from webp will be served as webp. Why do you want the non-webp version?
he wanted to save it, as in download it
FTP will give you the unmodified version

I was simply trying to get them all to show them the size savings from as a whole
